content:
• Monday, June 4, 2012
  • PNRA

    Panera Bread (NASDAQ:PNRA) slips in after hours trading following Starbucks' (NASDAQ:SBUX)...

    Panera Bread (NASDAQ:PNRA) slips in after hours trading following Starbucks' (NASDAQ:SBUX) announcement that it was picking up La Boulange parent company Bay Bread. Although SBUX didn't specifically say it was making a run at PNRA, the writing is definitely on the wall. Panera has been at the top of this sector for a long time now, and a cut of its market would be a tasty target for a heavyweight competitor the likes of Starbucks. PNRA -1.6%, SBUX -2.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • BRCD

    Brocade (NASDAQ:BRCD) -2% AH after disclosing sales chief Ian Whiting is leaving "to pursue...

    Brocade (NASDAQ:BRCD) -2% AH after disclosing sales chief Ian Whiting is leaving "to pursue other personal and professional interests." CEO Michael Klayko will handle Whiting's job until a permanent replacement is found. F5 Networks fell harder on similar news last week.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:27 PM
  • OPXT

    Opnext (NASDAQ:OPXT) +12.4% AH to $1.09 after disclosing it received and rejected an unsolicited...

    Opnext (NASDAQ:OPXT) +12.4% AH to $1.09 after disclosing it received and rejected an unsolicited offer to buy the company for $1.40/share. Opnext says its board concluded the offer isn't superior to an existing deal to merge with rival optical component vendor Oclaro (NASDAQ:OCLR). Oclaro's all-stock offer was worth $1.96/share at the time of the merger announcement, but is worth $0.97/share today. OCLR +2.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM
  • CNQR

    Concur Technologies (CNQR +7%) spiked higher in late trading after announcing the General...

    Concur Technologies (CNQR +7%) spiked higher in late trading after announcing the General Services Administration (GSA) had chosen Concur's software to handle its online bookings, travel authorization, and voucher processing needs. The GSA's contract runs for 15 years. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM
  • DG

    More on Dollar General (NYSE:DG): FQ1 beats across the board on strong sales and better overall...

    More on Dollar General (NYSE:DG): FQ1 beats across the board on strong sales and better overall margins. Same-store sales rose 6.7% Y/Y, while total sales improved by 13.0%. The company also raises FY12 guidance, now expecting to earn between $2.68 to $2.78 per share, up from its prior view of $2.65 to $2.75. Street estimates are at $2.76 per share. Separately, the company announces a 25M share secondary offering. Shares +1.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • SBUX

    Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) is buying Bay Bread, owner of the La Boulange bakery chain, for $100M in...

    Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) is buying Bay Bread, owner of the La Boulange bakery chain, for $100M in cash. The company plans to introduce La Boulange's pastries and breads to its U.S. coffee shops, while also expanding La Boulange's own U.S. retail presence. Starbucks expects the deal to dilute 2H12 EPS by $0.02. SBUX -2.4% AH. GMCR -2.6%. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 10 Comments
  • DG

    Dollar General (NYSE:DG): FQ1 EPS of $0.63 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $3.9B (+13% Y/Y) beats by...

    Dollar General (NYSE:DG): FQ1 EPS of $0.63 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $3.9B (+13% Y/Y) beats by $80M. Shares +2.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • SHFL

    Shuffle Master (NASDAQ:SHFL): Q2 EPS of $0.20 in-line. Revenue of $66.1M (+10.4% Y/Y) beats by...

    Shuffle Master (NASDAQ:SHFL): Q2 EPS of $0.20 in-line. Revenue of $66.1M (+10.4% Y/Y) beats by $1M. Shares +0.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • ADNC

    Voice processing chip/technology developer Audience (ADNC +4.7%), which posted a decent IPO last...

    Voice processing chip/technology developer Audience (ADNC +4.7%), which posted a decent IPO last month, rallied today after Deutsche's Brian Modoff started coverage with a Buy and $23 PT. Modoff argues Audience has "reinvigorated" mobile industry efforts to improve call quality, and notes the company's technology, which is used by Apple and Samsung, also lowers network traffic. He expects new phone and PC-related applications to open up in time.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • COO

    Cooper Cos. (COO -4.3%) makes a move to expand into the women's health-care market by announcing...

    Cooper Cos. (COO -4.3%) makes a move to expand into the women's health-care market by announcing plans to acquire Danish medical-device company Origio A/S through a roughly $151M tender offer.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • HBAN

    FBR downgrades seven regional banking lenders, pointing to the dismal outlook for interest rates...

    FBR downgrades seven regional banking lenders, pointing to the dismal outlook for interest rates and a "lack of material positive catalysts." Huntington Bancshares (HBAN -4.3%) and Boston Private Financial (BPFH -9.3%) are reduced to Underperform; ZION -3.5%, WAFD -1.4%, NYB -2%, NPBC -3.9% and FULT -2.9% are cut to Market Perform.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • NX

    Quanex Building Products (NX -2.9%) slips after posting a wider FQ2 loss amid lower sales...

    Quanex Building Products (NX -2.9%) slips after posting a wider FQ2 loss amid lower sales volumes and higher costs in its key aluminum segment. A flat housing sector and rising costs for raw materials and production continue to be an ongoing challenge for the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • GEOKQ

    Geokinetics (GOK +5.5%) pops after earlier naming David Crowley, most recently the chief...

    Geokinetics (GOK +5.5%) pops after earlier naming David Crowley, most recently the chief executive of Enventure Global Technology, as its new president and chief operating officer.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • CVGW

    Fresh foods supplier Calavo Growers (CVGW -11%) takes a hit after its FQ2 results sharply missed...

    Fresh foods supplier Calavo Growers (CVGW -11%) takes a hit after its FQ2 results sharply missed Street estimates earlier today. Net profit dipped 15% Y/Y as an oversupply of avocadoes and tomates pressured selling prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • SBUX

    Shares of Starbucks (SBUX +2.1%) keep trekking higher in advance of an announcement slated for...

    Shares of Starbucks (SBUX +2.1%) keep trekking higher in advance of an announcement slated for later today (webcast) on a new initiative for its U.S. retail business. Though nothing concrete has been leaked, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +2.7%) also trades higher ahead of the event on speculative bidding.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • ET-OLD

    Online/social media marketing solutions providers ExactTarget (ET-OLD +6.8%) and Constant...

    Online/social media marketing solutions providers ExactTarget (ET-OLD +6.8%) and Constant Contact (CTCT +4.1%) appear to be getting a lift from Salesforce.com's purchase of Buddy Media, as hopes grow of further consolidation in the space. Bazaarvoice (BV-OLD +0.2%), however, isn't joining in on the fun.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • SFL

    Ship Finance International (SFL -4%)) agrees to sell its 20-year old combination carrier Front...

    Ship Finance International (SFL -4%)) agrees to sell its 20-year old combination carrier Front Rider to an unrelated third party, while simultaneously agreeing to terminate the corresponding charter party with a subsidiary of Frontline Ltd (FRO -7.7%). SFL will receive approximately $10.2M, including a $500k charter termination compensation payment from FRO, and book gain of approximately $1.7M in Q312.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 3 Comments
  • ONXX

    Baird is defending Onyx Pharmaceuticals (ONXX -7.7%) mixed presentation yesterday at ASCO...

    Baird is defending Onyx Pharmaceuticals (ONXX -7.7%) mixed presentation yesterday at ASCO yesterday, saying that any weakness in the stock would be buying opportunity. The company presented both positive and negative data for Kyprolis, but Baird thinks it could be a best-in-class protease inhibitor that will eventually gain approval. It maintains its Neutral rating, but raises its price target to $45 from $41.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB -3.6%) has fallen below $27 in the wake of Bernstein's critical report and news of...

    Facebook (FB -3.6%) has fallen below $27 in the wake of Bernstein's critical report and news of a new Google local ad sales push. Other volatile Internet and social media names are unsurprisingly also diving: ZNGA -4.2%. GRPN -7.9%. YELP -6.8%. RENN -5.1%. Z -5.9%. Henry Blodget, who previously set a $16-$24 PT range for Facebook, discusses how multiple compression appears inevitable for the company as growth slows, judging by the histories of tech giants.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM | 6 Comments
  • PSUN

    Shares of Pacific Sunwear (PSUN +6.1%) run higher after CEO Gary Schoenfeld discloses via a SEC...

    Shares of Pacific Sunwear (PSUN +6.1%) run higher after CEO Gary Schoenfeld discloses via a SEC filing that he bought 150K shares of stock in a price range of $1.45-$1.47.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM | 2 Comments
  • MDGL

    BMO Capital adds to Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA +3%) updraft, upgrading it Outperform ahead of...

    BMO Capital adds to Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA +3%) updraft, upgrading it Outperform ahead of its full GALAXY data release and a more constructive view of ganetespib's potential for success. Ther firm also raises its price target to $10 from $5.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • LVS

    Execs with Las Vegas Sands (LVS -3.1%) tip off at the Goldman Sachs Lodging, Gaming, Restaurant...

    Execs with Las Vegas Sands (LVS -3.1%) tip off at the Goldman Sachs Lodging, Gaming, Restaurant & Leisure conference that there is more to the Asian gaming market than just Macau, as they note that Singapore is a "great cash cow" for the company. Not only does the property add to the firm's coffers, it serves as a "giant billboard" for Las Vegas, according to industry analysts. (webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake (CHK +4.6%) tops the S&P leader board after its decision to replace four...

    Chesapeake (CHK +4.6%) tops the S&P leader board after its decision to replace four directors, as investors agree with a Robert W. Baird analysis that the move "will go a long way in addressing the market's lack of confidence around Chesapeake's corporate governance and likely usher in a new culture of increased conservatism."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 2 Comments
  • CAKE

    Shares of Cheesecake Factory (CAKE -5.3%) swoon after taking on a downgrade from William Blair...

    Shares of Cheesecake Factory (CAKE -5.3%) swoon after taking on a downgrade from William Blair to Market Perform from Outperform. Analysts say field checks show soft sales for May and now see Q2 same-store sales coming in at or below the company's guidance range of 1.5%-2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • DNDN

    Baird says Dendreon's (DNDN -8.5%) Provenge may have a difficult road to commercial acceptance...

    Baird says Dendreon's (DNDN -8.5%) Provenge may have a difficult road to commercial acceptance especially after this weekend's ASCO meeting in which both Bristol Myers (BMY flat) and Medivation (MDVN -2%) published impressive trial results for their prostate drugs. The firm loweres its 2014 and 2015 estimates for Provenge and said the drug may have trouble remaining relevant.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • DAL

    Airline stocks (FAA -2.8%) are hit by a wave of selling as Delta (DAL -8.7%) reports passenger...

    Airline stocks (FAA -2.8%) are hit by a wave of selling as Delta (DAL -8.7%) reports passenger unit revenue rose less than expected in May and as the sector has enjoyed a big run-up this year on weakening crude oil prices. Delta, United Continental (UAL -6.2%) and US Airways (LCC -8.1%) are among the day's biggest decliners.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 2 Comments
  • AEZS

    ASCO Oncology conference: Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS -7.3%) slides after it presented disappointing...

    ASCO Oncology conference: Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS -7.3%) slides after it presented disappointing Phase 3 results for perifosine - one of its lead drug candidates - yesterday. Data from the tests showed no benefit in overall survival when adding perifosine to capecitabine in refractory colorectal cancer.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM | 6 Comments
  • NOK

    Nokia's (NOK +0.4%) Lumia phones continue to sell well, says Pac Crest's James Faucette after...

    Nokia's (NOK +0.4%) Lumia phones continue to sell well, says Pac Crest's James Faucette after conducting checks. Faucette believes both the Lumia 900 and 600 are faring well in the U.S., and that Euro sales rose M/M in May. On the other hand, he thinks Research In Motion (RIMM -4%) saw another month of sales declines, leading the company's channel inventory to rise to 6-8 weeks. That could be contributing to today's selloff to the single-digit range. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM | 4 Comments
  • LNG

    Cheniere Energy (LNG -8.3%) may be the company of the future but it's falling quickly in the...

    Cheniere Energy (LNG -8.3%) may be the company of the future but it's falling quickly in the present, according to an analysis by David White. The company's shares reflect the promise of its planned liquefied natural gas export terminals, but it's taking on huge debts at a time when most peers are cutting back; shares could "easily fall to $5 or below." CQP -13.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 2 Comments
  • SODA

    Shares of SodaStream (SODA +4.4%) trade higher as banter goes back and forth on the merits of...

    Shares of SodaStream (SODA +4.4%) trade higher as banter goes back and forth on the merits of the stock. What is one analyst's latest fad is another analyst's trendsetting industry changer. Also entering into the equation is the sudden focus on high-sugar drinks, with a report out highlighting that the SodaStream home-brewed cola comes in with only a third of the calories and sugar than offerings from beverage giants Coca-Cola and PepsiCo.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 4 Comments
  • MDGL

    Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA +2.8%) gains after saying a study of ganetespib, its lead drug...

    Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA +2.8%) gains after saying a study of ganetespib, its lead drug candidate, showed positive results as a treatment for oncologic indications, including a reduced rate of ocular toxicity. SNTA's primary research focus is on treatments for severe conditions such as cancer and chronic inflammatory diseases.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • TGA

    TransGlobe Energy (TGA -4.3%) is initiated with a Sector Perform and a $13 price targtet at...

    TransGlobe Energy (TGA -4.3%) is initiated with a Sector Perform and a $13 price targtet at RBCCapital, which says TGA's PSCs provide a hedge from any weakening in oil prices. The firm says a more positive outlook depends upon success with redevelopments and progress in the Western Desert.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • CYTR

    ASCO oncology conference: CytRx (NASDAQ:CYTR) -9.5% despite disclosing favorable results in a...

    ASCO oncology conference: CytRx (NASDAQ:CYTR) -9.5% despite disclosing favorable results in a Phase Ib/II clinical trial for its compound INNO-206 for advanced soft-tissue sarcoma. The plunge has been attributed to profit-taking after the stock rose 30% over the last few weeks. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • YUANF

    AuthenTec (AUTC +8%) catches a bid after SA's Josh Franklin suggests the next iPhone might...

    AuthenTec (AUTC +8%) catches a bid after SA's Josh Franklin suggests the next iPhone might feature an AuthenTec-supplied biometric sensor. Franklin notes a recent Apple patent filing that covers an NFC payment solution that includes a biometric sensor, as well as leaked iPhone casing pictures that include a slit for a biometric field. AuthenTec's efforts to develop biometric sensors for smartphones leads Franklin to think the company might supply Apple.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • AEM

    In an apparent reversal of strategy, Agnico-Eagle (AEM -1.3%) Mines is pulling capital out of...

    In an apparent reversal of strategy, Agnico-Eagle (AEM -1.3%) Mines is pulling capital out of Ontario’s Red Lake gold camp. Rubicon Minerals (RBY -7.3%), a junior miner in Red Lake, says AEM has sold off a "significant portion" of its RBY shares, which would explain why 17M-plus RBY shares changed hands on Friday.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 7 Comments
  • CMI

    Cummins (CMI -2.3%) takes a hit on a Wells Fargo downgrade to Market Perform, citing...

    Cummins (CMI -2.3%) takes a hit on a Wells Fargo downgrade to Market Perform, citing macroeconomic uncertainty and expectations for NAFTA truck industry production cuts. The firm lowers its price target range to $100 - $103 from $132 - $135.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • EHC

    HealthSouth (HLS +3%) trades higher after Wells Fargo upgrades the shares to Outperform on...

    HealthSouth (HLS +3%) trades higher after Wells Fargo upgrades the shares to Outperform on valuation and reduced regulatory risk in comparison to its peers. The firm has a $20 - $24 price target range.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • CALL

    MagicJack (CALL +7.4%) jumps after stating its Q2 revenue should exceed $36M - the consensus...

    MagicJack (CALL +7.4%) jumps after stating its Q2 revenue should exceed $36M - the consensus currently stands at $35.9M. The company, which partly attributes its performance to strong demand for its magicJack Plus product, also says it expects GAAP EPS to exceed $0.43, though this isn't comparable with a non-GAAP consensus of $0.29. MagicJack adds its put sales, recently the subject of a WSJ column, will have a minimal financial impact.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • YUM

    Shares of Yum Brands (YUM -2.3%) slip after the company is cut to Market Perform from Outperform...

    Shares of Yum Brands (YUM -2.3%) slip after the company is cut to Market Perform from Outperform at Raymond James. Analyst with the firm see middle-class spending in China as a random variable in the revenue equation for YUM and see valuation getting a bit stretched.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • DAL

    Airline stocks show notable weakness in early trading despite oil prices moving in the right...

    Airline stocks show notable weakness in early trading despite oil prices moving in the right direction. Traders lament the possibility that a slumping global economy could thwart growth in business travel. Decliners: DAL -6.3%, UAL -4.1%, LCC -4.1%, JBLU -2.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 2 Comments
  • GU

    Gushan Environmental Energy (GU +50.5%) agrees to be taken private by its Chairman, Jianqiu Yu,...

    Gushan Environmental Energy (GU +50.5%) agrees to be taken private by its Chairman, Jianqiu Yu, and his Trillion Energy Holdings for $1.62/share. GU is a manufacturer of copper products and producer of biodiesel in China.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • FLS

    Moody’s places its ratings on Flowserve (FLS +1.2%) on review for a possible upgrade after...

    Moody’s places its ratings on Flowserve (FLS +1.2%) on review for a possible upgrade after the maker of industrial valves and pumps unveiled a new capital structure program that included authorization for the expansion of its stock buyback program to $1B.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • BDBD

    Smart Balance (SMBL +9.5%) trades higher after Canaccord Genuity upgrades it to a Buy from Hold...

    Smart Balance (SMBL +9.5%) trades higher after Canaccord Genuity upgrades it to a Buy from Hold with a lofty price target of $8. Analysts cite the recent acquisition of Udi's and the growth potential in the health foods market as positive drivers for shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • SLS

    Galena Biopharma (GALE) +15.5% premarket after data from a clinical trial of NeuVax presented at...

    Galena Biopharma (GALE) +15.5% premarket after data from a clinical trial of NeuVax presented at ASCO reveals booster inoculations are well-tolerated and appear to maintain long-term peptide-specific immunity and reduce disease recurrence rates. Cantor Fitzgerald starts coverage of GALE at Buy, saying its breast cancer treatment "would represent major advances in prevention of disease."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM
  • KOG

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (NYSE:KOG) +1.8% premarket after providing an interim corporate update...

    Kodiak Oil &Gas (NYSE:KOG) +1.8% premarket after providing an interim corporate update discussing the recent completion of three high-working-interest wells in the Middle Bakken Formation in the Koala project area. One well was a successful remediation of a previously announced completion failure.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM

  • Market Preview: U.S. futures are flat to higher and EU shares are mostly up - except Germany -...

    Market Preview: U.S. futures are flat to higher and EU shares are mostly up - except Germany - led by Spain on hopes of a plan to rescue its banks and a small drop in unemployment. The S&P Benchmark +0.25%. Auxilium +6.8% following good test results for its Xiaflex drug for Peyronie's disease, although that's well down from earlier highs. Later: Employment Trends Index, Factory Orders
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • AN

    Shares of AutoNation (NYSE:AN) roar to a 5.7% gain premarket after the company sees strong sales...

    Shares of AutoNation (NYSE:AN) roar to a 5.7% gain premarket after the company sees strong sales growth in May.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • FOR

    Forestar (NYSE:FOR) agrees to acquire Credo Petroleum (CRED) for $14.50/share, or ~$146M. The...

    Forestar (NYSE:FOR) agrees to acquire Credo Petroleum (CRED) for $14.50/share, or ~$146M. The deal would provide FOR with "meaningful" ownership and operations in several strategic oil and gas formations including the Bakken and Three Forks. CRED +22.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • SLS

    Premarket gainers: GALE +16%. IMGN +8%. LDK +7%. AUXL +7%. MDVN +5%. Losers: DNDN -8%.

    Premarket gainers: GALE +16%. IMGN +8%. LDK +7%. AUXL +7%. MDVN +5%.
    Losers: DNDN -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • DNDN

    Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) -8.6% premarket after data from Johnson & Johnson (NYSE:JNJ) and...

    Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) -8.6% premarket after data from Johnson &Johnson (NYSE:JNJ) and Medivation (NASDAQ:MDVN) at the ASCO conference increases competitive pressure for DNDN's Provenge cancer drug. Patients taking JNJ's Zytiga in a late-stage pre-chemo prostate cancer study lived 27.2 months vs. 21.7 months for Provenge.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • WBA

    Shares of Walgreen (WAG) move up 3.4% premarket off of news that Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX)...

    Shares of Walgreen (WAG) move up 3.4% premarket off of news that Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX) and the company have dropped claims against each other. Though a new contract isn't in place yet that allows Walgreen customers to fill their Express Scripts prescriptions, ending back-and-forth litigation is certainly a step in the right direction.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM | 2 Comments
  • CHK

    Chesapeake (NYSE:CHK) announces an agreement with its two largest shareholders, Southeastern...

    Chesapeake (NYSE:CHK) announces an agreement with its two largest shareholders, Southeastern Asset Management and Carl Icahn, to reconstitute its Board of Directors by replacing four directors with three new directors selected by Southeastern and one by Icahn. Aubrey McClendon remains CEO. CHK +2.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM | 15 Comments
  • SDRL

    Seadrill (NYSE:SDRL) is in advanced discussions about a new five-year contract for its West...

    Seadrill (NYSE:SDRL) is in advanced discussions about a new five-year contract for its West Polaris drillship. The new contract will start in direct continuation of the existing assignment scheduled to be completed in October. The potential contract revenue for the five-year period is ~$1.16B. SDRL -2.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM | 5 Comments
  • S

    Clearwire shares +4.8% after Crest Financial said on Friday that it has bought a 5.9% holding,...

    Clearwire shares +4.8% after Crest Financial said on Friday that it has bought a 5.9% holding, making Crest one of Clearwire's biggest minority shareholders. Crest wants to open talks with the wireless operator, in which Sprint (NYSE:S) owns a majority stake, about its strategy and nominating directors to its board.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM
  • BMY

    Bristol Myers Squibb (NYSE:BMY) +2.3% premarket after results from an early-stage study show its...

    Bristol Myers Squibb (NYSE:BMY) +2.3% premarket after results from an early-stage study show its BMS-936658 experimental drug that helps the immune system attack cancer cells can reduce the size of tumors in patients with melanoma and non-small cell lung cancers. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM
  • AUXL

    Auxilium Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AUXL) moves up 23.1% premarket after announcing positive...

    Auxilium Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AUXL) moves up 23.1% premarket after announcing positive top-line results in testing on the use of its Xiaflex drug in treating Peyronie's disease.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:00 AM

  • EU stocks are mixed, with a small drop in Spanish unemployment and Portugal's €6.65B...

    EU stocks are mixed, with a small drop in Spanish unemployment and Portugal's €6.65B injection into three banks competing for investor attention with the miserable data from last week. EU STOXX 50 +0.3%, London closed, Paris +0.3%, Frankfurt -1.1%, Madrid +2.2%, Milan +0.8%, Lisbon +0.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 AM
  • SNE

    Sony (NYSE:SNE) dropped below ¥1,000/share in Tokyo trading for the first time since 1980,...

    Sony (NYSE:SNE) dropped below ¥1,000/share in Tokyo trading for the first time since 1980, falling as much as 2.3% to ¥990 before recovering slightly. Sony has posted four consecutive annual losses and "investors’ concern about Sony’s poor earnings seems to be turning into conviction," says Goldman analyst Takashi Watanabe. Currently: -1.7% in Tokyo.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 AM | 1 Comment

  • Asian markets get walloped, with weak China data compounding Friday's U.S. sell-off. Hong Kong...

    Asian markets get walloped, with weak China data compounding Friday's U.S. sell-off. Hong Kong -2.3% to 18130. China -2.7% to 2309. India -0.8% to 15835. In Tokyo, the Nikkei -1.7% to 8296, while the broader Topix fell as much as 2.2% earlier, hitting lows not seen since at least 1985.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 AM | 2 Comments
